title: #TeenageDirtbag challenge
material_description: digital screen recording of @parishilton's TikTok post
brief_description: Over 20 years since Wheatus released their song ‘Teenage Dirtbag’ its nostalgic allure is still as potent as ever. The “Teenage dirtbag” challenge has been popularized by users and celebrities alike, including Paris Hilton, Christina Aguilera and Tara Reid. Compiling photos from adolescence in the early 2000’ to the Wheatus song. Think emo, myspace, American Pie and of course Paris Hilton. Like most viral trends there has been a divide between younger gen z and the millennials who were actually around for the period, dubbed “Indie Sleeze”
description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Over 20 years since Wheatus released ‘Teenage Dirtbag’, its nostalgic allure remains as potent as ever. The “Teenage Dirtbag” challenge, which sees people compile photos of their early 2000s adolescence to the song, has been popularised by everyday users and celebrities alike, including Paris Hilton, Christina Aguilera and Tara Reid. Think emo, MySpace, American Pie and, of course, Paris Hilton. Like most viral trends there’s been a divide between younger Gen Z and the Millennials who were actually around for the “Indie Sleeze” period.

Like most viral trends there has been a divide between younger Gen Z and the Millennials who were actually around for the period dubbed “Indie Sleeze”.
